EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) supplying thermal energy (status: NO_FUEL; warnings: out of fuel).
• Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5) supporting fluid intake.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) & (x=-12.5, y=18.5) and at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) & (x=-2.5, y=21.5).
• Steam Engine – originally placed at (x=7.5, y=35.5) has been picked up for repositioning; all subsequent placement attempts (including candidate build area and placement adjacent to the Boiler with various spacing and directional adjustments) have failed, so the component is currently not established on the map.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) – reconfigured from copper‑cable to Iron Gear Wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for resource input.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) dispatching finished products.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) linking outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5) [note: blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5)].
 – Vertical segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5) [note: occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5)].
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem comprising:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) operating with reduced fuel levels.
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• RESOURCE AND POWER SUPPLY:
 – Furnaces and boilers must receive a continuous feed of ingredients and fuel; monitor boiler fuel delivery to address persistent NO_FUEL issues.
 – Confirm that key modules (lab and assembling machine) maintain stable electrical connectivity.

• STEAM ENGINE CONNECTION AND REPOSITION:
 – Placement distance errors indicate that the target buildable areas were too far from the player’s position (e.g. distances of 21.21 and 10.12 exceed the maximum allowed of 10). Ensure the player is positioned sufficiently close before attempting placement.
 – Repeated placement attempts—whether using direct buildable area checks or trying to position the engine adjacent to the Boiler—have failed due to obstructed or non-buildable candidate positions. Validate potential positions for collisions with nearby entities (transport belts, water, lab, electric poles, pipes, etc.) before placement.
 – Adjustments in spacing (from 0 up to 3) did not yield an unobstructed tile; reconsider the reference position or temporarily relocate conflicting entities to enable successful repositioning.

• BURNER INSERTER FUEL MANAGEMENT:
 – Monitor and adjust fuel distribution across burner inserters to mitigate low fuel or “out of fuel” warnings.

• TILE PLACEMENT & OCCUPANCY:
 – Pre‐validate target tile availability to avoid occupancy errors; ensure that target positions are free of obstacles before placing an entity.

• TYPE HANDLING:
 – Avoid calling non‐callable objects (such as Position) as functions; access attributes directly to prevent TypeErrors.

• GLOBAL SYSTEM CONFIGURATION:
 – Address persistent issues in power distribution and fluid connectivity by aligning overall system configurations and verifying unobstructed connection points.
